snippet: With two Gershwin-connected shows winning Tony Awards this week, the estates of George and Ira Gershwin are hopeful about their next project intended for Broadway: a stage musical of “An American in Paris.”
abstract: Trustees of George and Ira Gershwin’s estates rejoice after The Gershwins' Porgy and Bess, an adaptation of the opera Porgy and Bess, wins the Tony Award for best musical revival; plans are already underway for their next project, a stage adaptation of the film An American in Paris.
lead_paragraph: With two Gershwin-connected shows winning Tony Awards this week, the estates of George and Ira Gershwin are hopeful about their next project intended for Broadway: a stage musical of “An American in Paris.”

headline.seo: Gershwin Trustees Hopeful for a Broadway ‘American in Paris’
headline.main: Gershwin Shows’ Tonys Fuel Plans for a Musical
headline.print_headline: Gershwin Shows’ Tonys Fuel Plans for a Musical
